title: Instructional Design and Technology Competency Development Course Based on Informal Discussions

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Process for Pre-Service Teachers to Develop Instructional Design and Technology Integration Skills through Informal Discussions in a Smartphone-Based Microlearning Environment

learning_goals: Learners can explain how to apply instructional design models (e.g., ADDIE, SAM) to mathematics education through informal discussions in a microlearning environment.
Learners can improve their ability to design mobile learning scenarios by over 80% using real-time collaboration tools with peers.
Learners can develop a smartphone-based mathematics education content prototype by incorporating formative assessment feedback.

resources: Mobile App for Asynchronous Discussions (e.g., Slack, Band)
Mobile Version of Instructional Design Templates
10 Open-Source Microlearning Modules for Mathematics Education
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
